cscie55.hw3

Class Building

  • java.lang.Object
    • cscie55.hw3.Building

  • public class Building
extends java.lang.Object
    The building class simulates a multi-story building with multiple elevators.
    Assumption 1: In all the application and classes a 'second' means one loop or movement of all the elevators in the building (about 7 seconds in reality).
    Assumption 2: All elevators have the same capacity.
    Assumption 3: All floors have the same average arrivals per second.
    Assumption 4: Each elevator takes exactly ONE second to move UP or DOWN, AND to load and unload passengers.

    • Method Detail

      • moveElevators

        public void moveElevators(int times)
                   throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Moves all the elevators inside the building the specified number of times printing all their values every time that all elevators have moved.
        Parameters:
        times - Number of times to move all the elevators.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - If the main process is interrupted when it is sleeping.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Generates a string with the pertinent values of the building to show in the standard output.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String The String with the pertinent values for the simulation.

      • generateElevators

        private void generateElevators()
        Generates the building's Elevator objects in order to start the simulation.
        Post: Each elevator has been created with 0 passengers, equal capacity, and all of them are standing on the first floor.

      • generateFloors

        private void generateFloors()
        Generates the building's Floor objects in order to start the simulation.
        Post: Each of the floors have been created, including their waiting passengers and each of the passengers' destinations.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main method to demonstrate the features of the Application.
